data.name: Bitbucket codelines transformation
data.description:
If you ever came across Bitbucket you might have noticed the functionality of selecting lines of code in a file. 

It works as follows:
- You select multiple lines of code: 
![File in bitbucket with lines selected](data:image/png;base64,)
- All selected lines of code appear in the address bar:
![Selected lines appeared in address bar](data:image/png;base64,)
- Now you can share specific codelines with your colleagues.

The goal of this kata is to write that exact function.
It accepts an array of non-negative integers and returns a string of intervals.

---

Things to keep in mind about the function: 
- It accepts only an array of integers without duplicates. Returns an empty string if given a non-array as argument.
- String join policy:
  - join `>= 3` consecutive elements with a `-`.
  - join `<= 2` consecutive elements, and non-consecutive elements with a `,`.
